Appearance
From Wiktionary, the free dictionary
See also: skorpion, škorpion, and škorpión

German

[edit]
German Wikipedia has an article on:
Skorpion
Wikipedia de

Alternative forms

[edit]
  • Scorpion, Schorpion (obsolete)

Etymology

[edit]

From Middle High German scorpiōn, schorpiōn, relatinised variants of older schorpe, from Old High German scorpio, from Latin scorpio, from Ancient Greek σκορπίων (skorpíōn), variant of σκορπίος (skorpíos).

Pronunciation

[edit]
  • IPA(key): /skɔrˈpi̯oːn/, [skɔʁˈpjoːn], [skɔɐ̯-], [skɔ-], [-piˈoːn]
  • Trisyllabic pronunciation is very rare.
  • Audio:(file)
  • Audio (Germany (Berlin)):(file)

Noun

[edit]

Skorpion m (strong or mixed, genitive Skorpions, plural Skorpione or (now less common) Skorpionen)

  1. scorpion (arachnid of order Scorpiones)
  2. scorpio (one born in the sign of Scorpio)

Usage notes

[edit]
  • The predominant plural is Skorpione. The form Skorpionen has become rare in edited prose, but may still be heard as a variant in speech.

Declension

[edit]
Declension of Skorpion [masculine, strong // mixed]
singular plural
indef. def. noun def. noun
nominative ein der Skorpion die Skorpione, Skorpionen
genitive eines des Skorpions der Skorpione, Skorpionen
dative einem dem Skorpion den Skorpionen
accusative einen den Skorpion die Skorpione, Skorpionen

Related terms

[edit]
  • Skorpionsfliege
  • Wasserskorpion

Proper noun

[edit]

Skorpion m (proper noun, strong, genitive Skorpions)

  1. (astronomy) Scorpio, a constellation
  2. (astrology) Scorpio, a Zodiac sign used in astrology

See also

[edit]
Zodiac signs in German (layout · text)

[edit]
  • “Skorpion” in Duden online
  • “Skorpion” in Digitales Wörterbuch der deutschen Sprache

Hunsrik

[edit]

Pronunciation

[edit]
  • IPA(key): /ʃkorpiˈoːn/

Noun

[edit]

Skorpion m (plural Skorpion)

  1. scorpion

Further reading

[edit]
  • Boll, Piter Kehoma (2021), “Skorpion”, in Dicionário Hunsriqueano Riograndense–Português, 3rd edition (overall work in Portuguese), Ivoti: Riograndenser Hunsrickisch

Plautdietsch

[edit]

Noun

[edit]

Skorpion f (plural Skorpionen)

  1. scorpion

Polish

[edit]
Polish Wikipedia has an article on:
Skorpion (gwiazdozbiór)
Wikipedia pl

Pronunciation

[edit]
  • IPA(key): /ˈskɔr.pjɔn/
  • Audio:(file)
  • Rhymes: -ɔrpjɔn
  • Syllabification: Skor‧pion

Proper noun

[edit]

Skorpion m animal

  1. (astronomy) Scorpio, a constellation
  2. (astrology) Scorpio, a Zodiac sign used in astrology

Declension

[edit]
Declension of Skorpion
singular
nominative Skorpion
genitive Skorpiona
dative Skorpionowi
accusative Skorpiona
instrumental Skorpionem
locative Skorpionie
vocative Skorpionie

Noun

[edit]

Skorpion m pers or m animal

  1. (colloquial) Scorpio (someone with a Scorpio star sign)

Declension

[edit]
Declension of Skorpion
singular plural
nominative Skorpion Skorpioni / Skorpiony
genitive Skorpiona Skorpionów
dative Skorpionowi Skorpionom
accusative Skorpiona Skorpionów / Skorpiony
instrumental Skorpionem Skorpionami
locative Skorpionie Skorpionach
vocative Skorpionie Skorpioni / Skorpiony
